Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior glazed black with reserved band; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of draped figure facing right.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of the Louvre Centauromachy (near?)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski gives the following comparanda: ARV 740, 11 = CVA Altenburg (2) 21f pl. 70; ARV2 1091, 63 (49) = Boardman ARFV The Classical Period (1996) fig. 187; ARV2 1141, 24 (16) = CVA Altenburg (2) 10f pl. 53; CVA Adolphseck (1) 19 pl. 29,1 It seems ambitious to try to attribute this fragment.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.42 no. C 19 pl. 15.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1125)
